Gypsy, a term originally used to refer to the Romani people, an ethnic group on the Indian subcontinent, has gone hand and hand with hate and oppression since as early as the 15th century. Although Gypsy originally referred to one ethnic group it has been used as a slur for many poor and traveler groups throughout history. Gypsies and other groups associated with Gypsies have been enslaved and taken as prisoners of war consistently throughout conflicts of the past 5 centuries. Even to this day Gypsy are extremely over represented in statistics such as homelessness, displacement, and suicide. 

For more information on how your language can affect others: https://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2013/12/30/242429836/why-being-gypped-hurts-the-roma-more-than-it-hurts-you

Boy is a term that means 'a young male'. It is not offensive in all contexts, but has been used to discriminate against black men throughout American History. It has been used to try and take away the status of black men, reducing them to children. Please refrain from using 'boy' in future conversations.

For more information on how your language can effect others: https://discord.com/api/oauth2/authorize?client_id=1205592478355554324&permissions=2166975577158&scope=bot

'You people' is often used as an insult used to generalized and exclude a group of people. Furthermore, 'you people' creates separation betweeen you and who you are referring to. 

For more information on how your language can effect others: https://www.npr.org/2020/06/08/872371063/microaggressions-are-a-big-deal-how-to-talk-them-out-and-when-to-walk-away]
